text: The women's lightweight double sculls competition at the 2018 World Rowing Championships in Plovdiv took place at the Plovdiv Regatta Venue. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 9 September 2018 || 15:00 || Heats |- | Tuesday 11 September 2018 || 10:57 || Repechages |- | rowspan=2|Thursday 13 September 2018 || 11:36 || Semifinals A/B |- | 15:01 || Semifinals C/D |- | rowspan=4|Saturday 15 September 2018 || 09:54 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 12:01 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |- | 15:01 || Final C |- | 15:49 || Final D |} All times are Eastern European Summer Time (UTC+3) ==Results== ===Heats=== The two fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Kirsten McCann fastest boats in each repechage advanced to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the C/D semifinals. ====Repechage 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Patricia Merz Frédérique Rol | align="left"| | 6:57.90 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Natsumi Yamaryo Ayami Oishi | align="left"| | 7:00.67 | SA/B |- | 3 | align="left"|Aoife Casey Denise Walsh | align="left"| | 7:03.88 | SC/D |- | 4 | align="left"|Louisa Altenhuber Laura Arndorfer | align="left"| | 7:06.78 | SC/D |- | 5 | align="left"|Rocio Lao Sanchez Natalia de Miguel | align="left"| | 7:16.14 | SC/D |- | 6 | align="left"|Emma Benany Asmaa Alzohairy | align="left"| | 7:50.07 | SC/D |} ====Repechage 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Eleanor Piggott Emily Craig | align="left"| | 6:57.14 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Katherine Haber Jennifer Casson | align="left"| | 7:00.60 | SA/B |- | 3 | align="left"|Katrin Thoma Leonie Pless | align="left"| | 7:12.65 | SC/D |- | 4 | align="left"|Matinee Raruen Phuttharaksa Neegree | align="left"| | 7:16.95 | SC/D |- | 5 | align="left"|Nawel Chiali Zoubida Lachoub | align="left"| | 7:23.96 | SC/D |} ===Semifinals C/D=== All but the slowest boat in each semi were sent to the C final. The slowest boats were sent to the D final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Aoife Casey Denise Walsh | align="left"| | 7:20.51 | FC |- | 2 | align="left"|Rocio Lao Sanchez Natalia de Miguel | align="left"| | 7:24.08 | FC |- | 3 | align="left"|Matinee Raruen Phuttharaksa Neegree | align="left"| | 7:31.21 | FD |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Louisa Altenhuber Laura Arndorfer | align="left"| | 7:15.65 | FC |- | 2 | align="left"|Katrin Thoma Leonie Pless | align="left"| | 7:25.53 | FC |- | 3 | align="left"|Nawel Chiali Zoubida Lachoub | align="left"| | 7:28.06 | FC |- | 4 | align="left"|Emma Benany Asmaa Alzohairy | align="left"| | 7:56.02 | FD |} ===Semifinals A/B=== The three fastest boats in each semi advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Ionela-Livia Cozmiuc Gianina Beleagă | align="left"| | 6:59.23 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Emily Schmieg Mary Jones | align="left"| | 6:59.95 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Patricia Merz Frédérique Rol | align="left"| | 7:01.11 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Katherine Haber Jennifer Casson | align="left"| | 7:01.50 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Kirsten McCann Nicole van Wyk | align="left"| | 7:02.48 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Amy James Sarah Pound | align="left"| | 7:09.18 | FB |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Marieke Keijser Ilse Paulis | align="left"| | 7:05.62 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Zoe McBride Jackie Kiddle | align="left"| | 7:06.75 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Eleanor Piggott Emily Craig | align="left"| | 7:07.09 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Weronika Deresz Joanna Dorociak | align="left"| | 7:12.72 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Valentina Rodini Federica Cesarini | align="left"| | 7:12.90 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Natsumi Yamaryo Ayami Oishi | align="left"| | 7:14.41 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the other finals. ====Final D==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Matinee Raruen Phuttharaksa Neegree | align="left"| | 7:19.19 |- | 2 | align="left"|Emma Benany Asmaa Alzohairy | align="left"| | 7:52.69 |} ====Final C==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Aoife Casey Denise Walsh | align="left"| | 7:05.77 |- | 2 | align="left"|Louisa Altenhuber Laura Arndorfer | align="left"| | 7:08.29 |- | 3 | align="left"|Katrin Thoma Leonie Pless | align="left"| | 7:09.12 |- | 4 | align="left"|Rocio Lao Sanchez Natalia de Miguel | align="left"| | 7:13.31 |- | 5 | align="left"|Nawel Chiali Zoubida Lachoub | align="left"| | 7:20.59 |} ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Valentina Rodini Federica Cesarini | align="left"| | 7:04.91 |- | 2 | align="left"|Kirsten McCann Nicole van Wyk | align="left"| | 7:06.40 |- | 3 | align="left"|Katherine Haber Jennifer Casson | align="left"| | 7:07.07 |- | 4 | align="left"|Natsumi Yamaryo Ayami Oishi | align="left"| | 7:07.96 |- | 5 | align="left"|Weronika Deresz Joanna Dorociak | align="left"| | 7:08.77 |- | 6 | align="left"|Amy James Sarah Pound | align="left"| | 7:09.28 |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Ionela-Livia Cozmiuc Gianina Beleagă | align="left"| | 6:50.71 |- | | align="left"|Emily Schmieg Mary Jones | align="left"| | 6:52.30 |- | | align="left"|Marieke Keijser Ilse Paulis | align="left"| | 6:52.56 |- | 4 | align="left"|Patricia Merz Frédérique Rol | align="left"| | 6:54.80 |- | 5 | align="left"|Eleanor Piggott Emily Craig | align="left"| | 6:55.81 |- | 6 | align="left"|Zoe McBride Jackie Kiddle | align="left"| | 6:57.79 |} ==References== Category:2018 World Rowing Championships World
